identificationModule.officialTitle: Recombinant Human Prourokinase（rhPro-UK）for Injection Versus Standard Medical Treatment for Acute Mild Ischemic Stroke (NIHSS≤5) Within 4.5 Hours After Symptom Onset

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to investigate the safety and efficacy of rhPro-UK (35mg) versus standard medical treatment in acute mild ischemic stroke within 4.5 hours of symptom onset.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: After being informed about the study and potential risks, patients who meet the eligibility requirements will be randomized to recombinant human Prourokinase for injection (rhPro-UK) or standard medical treatment in a 1:1 ratio. Written informed consent will be needed.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: A multicenter, prospective, randomized, open-label, blinded-endpoint (PROBE) controlled trial

armGroups.label: rhPro-UK (35mg)
armGroups.description: rhPro-UK: 35 mg (5 mg per vial, 7 vials in total) Dissolve 15mg (3 vials) of rhPro-UK in 10ml of saline and intravenous bolus within 3 minutes, and dissolve the remaining 20mg (4 vials) in 90ml of saline and intravenous drip within 30 minutes. (Note: after adding saline, overturn it gently once to twice, do not shake vigorously, so as to avoid foaming of the rhPro-UK solution and reduce the efficacy).
interventionNames: Drug: Recombinant Human Prourokinase for Injection (rhPro-UK)

armGroups.label: standard medical treatment
armGroups.description: Standard antiplatelet or anticoagulant treatment at the discretion of local investigators according to the 'Chinese guidelines for diagnosis and treatment of acute ischemic stroke 2018'.

interventions.name: Recombinant Human Prourokinase for Injection (rhPro-UK)
interventions.description: 15mg of rhPro-UK intravenous bolus within 3 minutes, and the remaining 20mg intravenous drip within 30 minutes.

interventions.name: standard medical treatment
interventions.description: Standard antiplatelet or anticoagulant treatment at the discretion of local investigators.

primaryOutcomes.measure: The modified Rankin Scale score (mRS) ≤ 1 at 90 days
primaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of the modified Rankin Scale score (mRS) ≤ 1 at 90 days.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ordinal distribution of mRS at 90 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ordinal distribution of mRS at 90 days
The proportion of mRS score ≤ 2 at 90 days
Clinical response rate at 24 hours defined as an improvement on NIHSS score ≥ 4 points compared with the initial deficit or NIHSS score ≤ 1 point

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Barthel index of 75-100 points at 90 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of Barthel index of 75-100 points at 90 days
The value of Quality of Life (EQ-5D-5L) at 90 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Activities of Daily Living (Lawton IADL) at 90 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: The score of Activities of Daily Living (Lawton IADL) at 90 days
The rate of symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 36 hours (as defined by ECASS III)
The rate of systematic bleeding at 90 days (as defined by GUSTO: moderate and severe bleeding)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Adverse events (AEs)/ serious adverse events (SAEs) within 90 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of AEs/SAEs within 90 days

locations.facility: Beijing Tiantan Hospital, Capital Medical University
